At that time, when the World-Honored One was expounding this Dharma, there was a yaksha named Pomo who shouted loudly,

Today, the World-Honored One, in the Deer Park at Varanasi, the abode of sages, turned the wheel of the Dharma of the Four Noble Truths and twelve aspects three times, out of compassion and benefit for the world, the heavens, Brahma, Mara, the gods, humans, ascetics, and Brahmins.

When the yaksha Pomo finished shouting this, the Four Heavenly Kings, the Thirty-three Celestials, and the various gods called out to each other, and in an instant, even up to the Brahma realm, all the Brahma gods heard and knew that the World-Honored One, in the Deer Park at Varanasi, the abode of sages, turned the wheel of the Dharma three times, and the Three Jewels appeared, benefiting humans, gods, and all beings.

At that time, the earth shook greatly, and the heavens became bright. Then, Brahma, Indra, and the various gods each held jeweled banners, flags, and canopies, and came to where the Buddha was. They rained down heavenly flowers, played heavenly music, sang praises, made various offerings, rejoiced and leaped for joy, and withdrew after bowing to the Buddha.
